channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Kidnappers lane - safety concerns, 6th July
item.description:
Kidnappers lane has become a thoroughfare for commuter and school traffic in the morning. The road is in poor repair, single pass in places, and drivers often speed down the road rushing in the mornings. Increasingly the road is used by HSL pupils to walk to school, or younger children to Leckhampton C of E school. Near misses are becoming ever more common, and I fear an accident is waiting to occur. As the new housing developments (Miller & Newlands) are completed the problems will only get worse. Please can this issue be reviewed properly before any serious accidents occur.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken, damaged and missing potholes, 6th July
item.description:
3 drains in the cat park outside Meadow Lea. Council should know where this is, because I'm certain I'm not the first person to report it. I've seen this reported 3 or 4 times in the last 2 years. This has been a issue for almost 3 years, since Jan 2023.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadow Lea, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Road - Kidnappers Lane, 6th July
item.description:
Kidnappers Lane, between Farm Lane and Church Road is an accident waiting to happen. The width, corners and passing points are not safe and fit for purpose. The number of potholes make the road even narrower. The amount of use has increased massively with the school, nursery and development, but no effort has gone into pedestrians, cyclists or drivers. A complete rethink and improvement to the roads in Leckhampton is required. The number of times children need to cross the road is dangerous and lighting is insufficient in the winter. Tress and hedgerows block visibility at crossing points. The speed limit should be reduced immediately to 15 MPH. (that is the safe speed anyway). Zebra crossing needs to be in place. The pot holes should be filled in. Church Road and Farm Lane are also not fit for purpose. Work is required to fix the issues. I just hope the improvements are made before a serious accident not after.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Flyposter for cafe on railings, 5th July
item.description:
This flyposter is attached to the railings by the entrance to the nature reserve. It is one of many of exactly the same flyposters dotted around Leckhampton, including the one attached to the telegraph pole on the corner of Westbury Rd and Old Bath Road. Multiple posters have had to be removed from that spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 200, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
